Ad Text:
Contract - Financial Analyst 3/6 months - perm

The purpose of this role is to develop, implement, and improve cash and working capital reporting including implementation of processes and controls related to the efficient management of working capital and cash for the  business. This will be achieved through:
Ownership of daily and weekly cash reporting and the tracking of cash and working capital balances relative to plan across all the multiple units
Developing reporting templates to improve efficiency in tracking, managing, and forecasting operating cash inflows, outflows, and working capital balances at a contact level
Report and reconcile monthly Operating Cash, Working Capital balances, and CAPEX for two units
Actively engage and partner with BU finance teams to provide insight on working capital information and trends, and assist teams with implementing proactive controls and reporting processes to manage this with respective operational teams.
Provide analysis, reporting, and support the Units for Finance and Management teams related to Cash, CAPEX, and Working Capital.
Reporting, Delivery and Performance Management:

Play a proactive role in development of cash and working capital reporting insight and the associated processes related to management of cash and working capital across business units and contracts to ensure compliance and delivery 
Responsible for daily updating of actual cash inflows and outflows as well as 12 week rolling cash forecast for Treasury to enable robust compliance with liquidity requirements
Daily and weekly monitoring of bank accounts, debtor and unclaimed work in progress balances by contract
Running intercompany loan reports to reconcile and validate cash actuals 
Preparation and co-ordination of aged debtors reporting across BU's and Contracts
Preparation and co-ordination of CAPEX reporting across BU's and Contracts
Build and manage key relationships with BU finance teams to understand contractual terms and contract variations that impact cash and working capital
Contribute to weekly cash call meetings with BU Finance and Group Treasury teams
Assist with co-ordination of the investing cash and capex forecasting process, reporting and analytics
Provide support to coordinate the periodic cash flow and CAPEX forecast submissions 
Contribute to business and strategic plan development 
Strategy, Planning and Business Improvement:

Assist with co-ordination of the investing cash and capex forecasting process, reporting and analytics
Provide support to coordinate the periodic cash flow and CAPEX forecast submissions in the system and assist in evaluation of cash and working capital efficiency, risks and opportunities
Partner with BU Finance teams, Financial Control team to drive best practice and continuous process improvement to ensure robust cash forecasts, controls and reporting
Manage ad hoc projects both inside and outside areas of expertise, in line with business needs and influencing stakeholders of all levels across multiple locations with analytical solutions and process/control improvements
Support organisational and cultural change through innovation and striving for excellence change
Business Analysis & Customer Service

Empower finance leads and management to identify, monitor, understand and manage key performance indicators related to cash and working capital
Provide business insights spanning, budgeting, forecasting of cash flow management, foreign exchange, interest rate and commodity risks to improve business outcomes
Support the Serviced Teams to deliver project work and meet compliance requirements
Increase financial and commercial acumen (including finance process, working capital metrics and efficient robust practices etc.)
Engage stakeholders; support them to manage their financial deliverables and accountabilities
Immediate start!

Senior Data Platform Architect

Location: Sydney
Type: Permanent/Full-Time

We are partnering with a large, high‑profile organisation undergoing significant digital and data transformation. They are seeking a Senior Data Platform Architect to shape enterprise data strategy, design scalable data platforms, and guide best‑practice data management across the organisation.

The Role

In this role, you will define enterprise-wide data architecture, develop conceptual and logical data models, and ensure data standards, governance, and integration approaches support both current and long-term organisational needs. You will work closely with Architecture, Data & Analytics, and Technology teams to uplift data capability and influence strategic decision-making.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain enterprise-level conceptual data models and data blueprints.
Define data management standards, taxonomies, naming conventions, and metadata practices.
Lead architectural governance across data warehousing, BI, integration, MDM, metadata, and document management.
Map enterprise data to business processes, systems, and technology platforms.
Identify gaps in data architecture practices and lead initiatives to address them.
Contribute to data governance activities and act as a member of architecture review forums.
Stay current with industry data standards and emerging technologies, championing their adoption.

Technical Requirements (Essential)

10+ years in IT with 5+ years in information systems architecture/design.
Proven experience designing and implementing enterprise information solutions.
Hands‑on experience with MDM, data integration, data warehousing, BI, and document management.
Expertise in cloud platforms and modern data tech, including:
AWS
Snowflake
Big Data ecosystems / data lake architectures
Strong background in enterprise architecture, data governance, data modelling, information classification, and data integration patterns.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent experience.

Desirable Skills

Advanced data modelling across relational, object, and semantic models.
Knowledge of metadata management, taxonomies, ontologies, and applying structured techniques to unstructured data.
Familiarity with industry data models (e.g., PPDM, PODS).
Strong communication, stakeholder engagement, and facilitation skills.
Ability to assess emerging technologies and translate them into practical business value.
Experience working in large, complex organisations.

Why Apply?

You'll play a pivotal role in shaping an enterprise data ecosystem at scale - with direct influence on strategy, governance, and the future-state data landscape.

About us:

Bapcor Ltd is the leading automotive aftermarket provider of accessories, equipment and service. We host one of the widest ranges of car parts in the world, with brands including Burson, Autobarn, Midas, Truckline, Premier Auto Trade and Baxters.

We’re more than just automotive — we’re a dynamic, purpose-led organisation powered by people. Our Melbourne-based corporate team plays a critical role in shaping the strategy and success of the Bapcor Group.

In joining our team, you’ll be welcomed into a supportive business that spans more than 1,000 locations with over 5,000 team members across Australia, New Zealand and Thailand. We are passionate about our team, with safety and inclusivity at the forefront of everything we do. We’re also passionate about our customers, products, and living our values of:

Doing the right thing

Being in it together

Giving a damn

Getting it done




About the role

Reporting directly to the CTO and member of the Technology Leadership Team, the Head of Business Intelligence will lead Bapcor’s enterprise data and analytics agenda. This is a role for a seasoned leader who thrives on simplifying complexity, driving transformation, and building strong, trusted partnerships across both technology and business.

You will set the strategy, lead the team, uplift capability, and embed a customer‑centred, insight‑driven culture across all Bapcor business units. This includes Trade, Retail, Specialist Wholesale and our rapidly evolving commercial truck parts portfolio.

Bapcor is on a journey to simplify and modernise its data landscape. This role is pivotal in refreshing and streamlining complex legacy data systems, establishing scalable data foundations, leveraging BI to unlock commercial and customer value and driving innovation through strategic vendor partnerships. The role is also expected to drive reporting innovation through AI.

What You Will Lead & Deliver:

 Set and drive Bapcor’s enterprise BI strategy and roadmap, ensuring alignment with business priorities and long‑term technology direction.

Lead the design, development and optimisation of data platforms, including data pipelines, modelling, analytics products, dashboards and reporting.

Oversee data governance, quality and standards, ensuring accuracy, accessibility, compliance and consistency across the organisation.

Partner with executives, senior leaders and operational teams to translate business needs into actionable insights that drive performance and customer outcomes.

Champion a data-driven culture across Bapcor, uplifting capability, enabling self‑service analytics and promoting data literacy across the enterprise.

Simplify, modernise and transform legacy data systems, uplifting scalability, reliability and efficiency of the BI and analytics ecosystem.

Provide strong leadership to the BI team and external partners, building capability, driving performance and delivering value through effective vendor and stakeholder management.

Contribute as a senior member of the Technology Leadership Team, influencing enterprise technology strategy, investment and decision making.

 

What You’ll Bring

15+ years’ experience in IT, with deep expertise across Data Analytics, BI, Data Science, Program Delivery and IT Business Engagement in large, complex environments.

Strong leadership capability, with a proven track record of building, coaching and developing high‑performing technical and analytical teams.

Strategic thinker with enterprise mindset, able to define data and BI direction, simplify complexity and influence senior stakeholders and executives.

Exceptional stakeholder and communication skills, able to translate technical concepts into clear business outcomes and engage confidently at all organisational levels.

Proven experience modernising data platforms, with strong understanding of data governance, data quality, analytics tools, and (ideally) Azure Data Platforms.

Commercial and financially astute, with strong understanding of accounting principles, budget management, vendor management and commercial negotiations.

Highly effective problem solver and delivery leader, skilled in project management, prioritisation, navigating ambiguity, and executing in fast‑paced environments.

Customer‑focused, results‑driven and adaptable, demonstrating resilience, attention to detail and the ability to learn, evolve and drive continuous improvement.

Why join Bapcor?

At Bapcor, we focus on what matters most for our customers, team members and the communities we serve. We go the extra mile to get the job done and always live our values.

In joining our team, you can access:

Diverse career opportunities within the Bapcor Group

Discounts across Bapcor products and services, including our Retail and Trade brands

Industry leading policies to support your work/ life balance (gender neutral parental leave, purchase leave, volunteer leave etc…)

Paid birthday leave

Wellbeing support

Novated leasing and more

We pride ourselves on our inclusive work environment, and encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures, gender identity, abilities and backgrounds, providing a recruitment experience that’s fair, free from bias and accessible. If you need to inquire about reasonable accommodation for the application process, please email careers@bapcor.com

 

No Recruitment Agencies Please!

While we understand that recruitment agencies would love to offer their support, we kindly request all agencies to refrain from contacting us regarding this job posting. All applications should be submitted directly by candidates.

Manager, Strategic Planning and Investment, Strategy and Investment Portfolio, Chancellery Division, Queensland University of Technology

Reference number: 26124
Term: ongoing, full-time basis
Remuneration: $172,761 to $193,229 pa (HEW10) (inclusive of $145,985 to $163,281 salary pa, 17% superannuation and 17.5% recreation leave loading)
Location: Gardens Point (hybrid option available)
Open to: Applicants who have ongoing full-time work rights in Australia. In support of our strategic priority of Indigenous Australian success, Aboriginal Australians and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

Who are we looking for?

We are seeking a Manager, Strategic Planning and Investment to join , Chancellery Division.

The Manager, Strategic Planning and Investment is a senior individual contributor within Strategic Planning and Performance who plays a lead role in delivering QUT’s strategy, investment and planning processes. The position partners with senior leaders to run the end?to?end strategy cycle, builds and curates the fact base and insights that inform strategic choices, and sets business case standards for major investments. The role also ensures portfolio?wide transparency, prioritisation and decision support across QUT’s program of major investments, working closely with FBS and ePMO to align strategy, resources, capacity and delivery.

We’re offering this role as a hybrid position as part of QUT’s commitment to embracing the opportunities created by a more virtual and connected world.

About us

QUT is a major Australian university with a global outlook and a 'real world' focus. We are an ambitious and collaborative institution that seeks to equip our students and graduates with the skills they will need in an increasingly disrupted and challenged world.

The Strategy and Investment Portfolio brings together the Office of the Vice-President Strategy and Investment (VPS&I), Strategic Planning and Performance (SPP), Finance Business Solutions (FBS), and Enterprise Portfolio Management Office (ePMO). 

Within this portfolio, SPP leads institution-wide planning, performance analysis and strategic investment processes that underpin QUT’s academic and financial sustainability, including student load planning, executive analytics and business case support..

What you need to succeed

Education, training and/or relevant experience equivalent to the completion of postgraduate qualifications in a relevant discipline (e.g., economics, finance, data science, public policy).
Strong conceptual and analytical problem-solving capability with a proven ability to navigate ambiguity, frame complex, cross-portfolio problems and deliver practical, high-impact solutions.
Demonstrated experience leading strategy, embedding and operationalising strategic alignment and benefits within planning and/or investment governance in complex organisations – including monitoring and educating stakeholders around business case standards, validating and interpreting portfolio reporting, and Executive decision support.
Demonstrated highly developed financial modelling capability, including driver-based forecasting, scenario analysis and valuations (NPV/IRR/cashflow); experience building and maintaining enterprise-grade models.
Advanced analytics capability and comfort working with large data sets; proficiency with Excel and BI tools (e.g., Power BI); Python skills desirable for model automation/quality assurance.
Excellent communication skills (oral and written) with the ability to synthesis analysis into clear narratives and to influence senior stakeholders (ELT, Deans, Divisions leaders) without formal authority.

Life at QUT

We're committed to building a culture that fosters connection between people and purpose. Beyond personal and professional fulfillment, a career at QUT offers:

A healthy work-life balance with a blend of on-campus and off-campus work arrangements for applicable positions.
Competitive remuneration with up to 17% superannuation and leave loading of 17.5%.
Generous parental leave including primary carer parental leave of up to 26 weeks (including 17% super).
Stay healthy with Fitness Passport and enjoy discounted rates on private health insurance.
Purchased Leave Scheme - up to 8 extra weeks.
Salary Packaging Scheme for additional superannuation contributions, vehicle leasing, and on-campus services such as childcare, parking, and gyms.
Numerous opportunities for professional development including leadership programs and workshops, and our study assistance scheme.
Commitment to our Indigenous Australian staff  through initiatives such as the Indigenous Australian Staff Network, Cultural and Ceremonial Leave, Staff Development Workshops, and representation on university committees.

Explore more benefits of life at QUT.

Belong at QUT 

We are guided by our values of Ambition, Integrity, Inclusiveness, Innovation, and Academic Freedom and our QUT Connections in our mission to inspire and shape the next generation of change-makers.

As part of our commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace, we proudly support our Indigenous Australians Employment Strategy, aiming for an Indigenous Australian workforce participation of 3.6%. We extend a warm invitation to Aboriginal Australians and Torres Strait Islander people to join us in pursuing a rewarding career at QUT.

We believe that diversity is our strength and are dedicated to creating safe, inclusive spaces where everyone can thrive. We strongly encourage individuals from diverse cultures, ages, linguistic backgrounds, sexual orientations, and gender identities, and those who are living with disabilities to apply for positions at QUT.

At QUT, diversity is not just embraced—it's celebrated. See our commitment

How to Apply

Discover the possibilities that await with a career at QUT. If you're ready to embark on a journey of innovation and opportunity, we're excited to meet you.

Find out more about this position and submit your application by clicking 'Apply' or the link below.

View the job details at: https://qut.nga.net.au/?jati=F947D67A-0C45-E600-07D5-ECAC9D244012 

Job opens: 26-Feb-2026

Applications Close: 12-Mar-2026 at 11.30pm

As our highly valued Manager, Credit Risk Analytics based in Brisbane you will bring your strong analytical skills to support the Senior Manager, Credit Strategy, to execute the credit risk optimisation strategy for Great Southern Bank.

Working with key partners and internal stakeholders, you will pro-actively manage critical quantitative models and tools used in the origination and management of the bank's retail lending products (Home Loans, Credit Cards and Personal Loans) in a way that balances growth, customer experience and credit risk.

You'll make an impact by:

Leadership

You are accountable in supporting the development of a credit risk strategy that supports the bank's strategic objectives across its key portfolios and customer segments and assisting in the articulation of that strategy with senior leaders, executives, directors and regulators.
You will provide thought leadership across teams including Risk, Products, Projects and Data to influence effective design and delivery of leading loan origination pathways.

Credit Risk

In conjunction with the Senior Manager, Credit Strategy, you will design automated decisioning acquisition strategies and models to support existing and new products.
Using robust credit risk management techniques you will ensure the credit risk models and tools are designed in line with our Model Risk framework including appropriate monitoring and review that drives continuous improvement. This will include monitoring outcomes and performance, application of quantitative techniques, professional credit risk judgement, engagement with internal senior stakeholders and external partners, forums and regulators.
You will maintain and monitor the data and reporting for our credit risk tools and provide succinct summaries to the executive and credit committees. You will thrive for continuous improvement across credit risk models, tools and practices.
You will leverage your colleagues in the Credit Risk team, supporting each other with insights and professional opinions to drive outcomes across credit oversight, policy and loan decisioning tools.

Reporting, Analysis and Insights

You will develop and design regular reporting and analysis relating to application trends, new originations, and portfolio.
You will design and deliver reporting and insights that helps ensure the Board is able to fulfil its obligations for oversight of the lending portfolios.
You will support recurring and ad hoc quantitative analysis to ensure portfolio health is understood and to identify opportunities to better manage risk-return.
You may be required to support ongoing management of the provision model, including reporting as well reviewing and validating the model remains fit for purpose.
You may be required to conduct portfolio stress testing to further support credit insights and to contribute to enterprise stress testing and ICAAP.

Systems and partners

You will have dual responsibility for the execution and risk management of credit risk strategy, including design, business requirements, test planning and execution, model governance, data requirements etc.
You will work closely with technology platform owners and business owners to prioritise delivery of credit risk solutions into those platforms.

Partners and stakeholders

You will work the Senior Manager, Credit Strategy, Product Managers, Data and Technology partners and the management of our key external risk partners including but not limited to mortgage insurance, credit bureaux, valuation and scorecard providers and validators.



Do things differently with us

To succeed in this role, you will have:

5+ years' experience in credit risk management roles within Financial Services
Strong understanding of commonly used credit tools and decision engines and how to create the best value through their use
Proficient with data extraction, manipulation, and analysis (DataBricks and or SQL is essential).
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Familiarity with the Australian market, regulations (APRA, ASIC, AFCA)

Why Great Southern Bank?

Whatever your role with us, you'll be part of a force for good. We're owned by our customers right here in Australia, so our success benefits everyday people and families. Working at Great Southern Bank, you'll also enjoy a range of fantastic benefits, some examples include:

Helping you unlock a brighter future by investing in your development and wellbeing, offering you study leave, a day for you and professional wellbeing coaching.
Benefits that support you and your wellbeing so that you can thrive at work and at home, today and tomorrow. Enjoy access to our wellbeing centre and the flexibility to work from home two days a week.
Helping you to achieve your financial goals and positively impact your family and community. We offer discounts on a wide range of Great Southern Bank products and services such as savings and transaction accounts, insurance, home loans and more!

Imagine working for a bank that truly helps people. You can.

Questions? Please contact our Talent Acquisition team at careers@gsb.com.au

At Great Southern Bank, we're committed to building a strong, inclusive and diverse workplace, where people feel a sense of belonging and are valued, connected and respected. We value diverse backgrounds, cultures, abilities, ideas and experiences; recognising the benefits they bring to our work, our communities and the way we help our customers. We support and promote an inclusive culture through flexible ways of working, collaboration, and fair and equitable decision making that empowers our people to be at their best every day.

We move with purpose, are curious about what's next, remain focused on what matters most, and are always ready to find smarter ways to help our customers and communities thrive. Our people bring energy and initiative to a fast-changing environment, making thoughtful decisions that balance doing good for our customers with driving sustainable success for our business. If you enjoy working in a place where priorities evolve, ideas are valued, and every action contributes to something bigger, you'll feel right at home here at Great Southern Bank.

Salary: Love Health & Wellbeing so do we!
Ad Text:
Allow your Financial capability and analytical mind to create outcomes lead the way to your success.
We have leading Parental Leave  - designed for both parents! 
Proudly partnered with The Smith Family supporting First Nations Youth Education 
About Iplex


At Iplex we are committed to a powerful vision – Providing Safe & Secure Water to the World Around Us. We do this by forging partnerships with our customers and communities to deliver safe, secure, and innovative water solutions that not only address the present needs but also lay a solid foundation for future generations. 


As Australia's leading manufacturer and supplier of pipeline systems, we take pride in our pivotal role within Australia’s water industry. We understand the significance of our work, and we are driven by the shared goal of creating a better future.  Join us today to lead a passionate team dedicated to shaping a brighter future and leaving a lasting impact on Australia's water landscape. 


What is Your New Role About? 


We have recently redesigned the role of Program Analyst based in Strathpine to ensure we get the outcomes we need. You will take complex, raw financial data from multiple internal and third-party sources and transform it into clear, compelling insights, executive packs and visually engaging decks that support informed decision making across a diverse group of leaders. Reporting to the Program Contracts and Performance Manager you will play an integral role in budgeting, forecasting, performance tracking and financial governance reporting, ensuring our Program remains on track across scheduling, cost, turnaround and build times. 


Working within a small, collaborative and supportive team, this role is ideal for someone who enjoys both analytical depth and human connection. You will partner closely with internal stakeholders and external providers, confidently drawing data together, challenging assumptions and communicating insights with clarity and influence. Exposure to governance, compliance and fast‑moving timeframes will be key, along with the ability to adapt, prioritise and stay calm under change. 


Ideal Skills & Experience 
You are the expert on all things digital, Excel, Power Bi, Tableau, SAP, JDE or similar 
Proven experience creating high quality executive reports, data sets and presentations
Comfortable working with third party data sources to track outcomes and opportunities
Confident in working in fast changing environments with variable priorities 
Passionate about building trust, listening and influencing stakeholders 
Exposure to regulatory compliance frameworks would be highly regarded 
Relevant qualifications in either Finance, Commercial or Accounting  
Why Join Our Team at Iplex 
Excellent Remuneration for the right candidate
Enjoy flexible work arrangements – 2 days from home
Rare opportunity to join a major program in a leading business
Leading parental leave policy – 26 weeks paid for primary caregiver
We are endorsed by Reconciliation Australia for our Innovate RAP
Paid industry Membership to help grow your career ie NAWO
Proud partners of The Smith Family supporting youth education 
We are Proudly an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from people of all diverse backgrounds and identities, including Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples, people with disability, culturally and linguistically diverse communities, LBGTQIA+ People and Veterans.
No Agency Support Required -Thank you

Job Title: Senior Manager - Market Risk Internal Audit
Ad Text:
Internal Audit – Financial Markets & Market Risk
Join a Leading Global Financial Services Organisation

We are partnering with a leading global financial services group to recruit an experienced Internal Audit Manager/Senior Manager specialising in Financial Markets and Market Risk.

Based in Sydney, this role sits within a high-performing Internal Audit function, providing independent assurance across risk management, governance, and control frameworks. This is an excellent opportunity for a market risk specialist to step into a strategic, high-impact audit role with strong visibility across the business.

The Opportunity

As a subject matter expert, you will play a key role in reviewing and enhancing market risk practices.

You will work closely with stakeholders across trading, risk, and senior leadership teams to assess controls, evaluate frameworks, and provide insights on emerging risks.

Key Responsibilities

Lead and deliver audits across market risk frameworks and trading activities

Assess controls relating to VaR, sensitivities, stress testing, and scenario analysis

Review commodities trading activities and associated risk drivers

Analyse complex trading strategies and risk models

Identify emerging risks and contribute to audit planning

Partner with stakeholders to provide commercially relevant insights and recommendations

Leverage data analytics tools to enhance audit quality and efficiency

About You

You are a technically strong market risk professional with the ability to operate in a complex, fast-paced financial markets environment.

Key requirements:

Strong knowledge of market risk management (VaR, stress testing, sensitivities)

Experience in commodities trading and/or global markets

Background in market risk, front-office risk, or internal audit (5+ years)

Understanding of regulatory frameworks and industry best practice

Strong analytical skills with experience assessing risk models and trading strategies

Exposure to data analytics, visualisation tools, or programming languages (desirable)

Tertiary qualification in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, or similar

Professional certifications such as FRM, CFA, or CA/ACA (preferred)

What’s on Offer

Hybrid and flexible working arrangements

Generous parental leave and wellbeing benefits

Additional leave entitlements and volunteer days

Strong learning and development support, including professional accreditation

High-performing, collaborative team environment

Opportunity to work closely with senior stakeholders across global markets

Why Apply?

This is a unique opportunity to step into a senior, high-impact role where you will influence market risk practices and gain exposure across a global financial institution.

How to Apply

If this opportunity aligns with your experience and career goals, click Apply Now or reach out to Morgan Rember for a confidential discussion.

Perth Airport is Australia’s Western Hub connecting the people, businesses and communities of Western Australia with the rest of Australia and the world. Operating 24 hours a day, seven days a week throughout the year, Perth Airport plays a significant role in providing economic, social and cultural benefits to West Australians.

Perth Airport is investing more than $5 billion in new infrastructure so we can support our airline partners to grow, offering more services to new destinations and an improved customer experience. This will be the largest funded private equity build in Western Australia for the last 30 years.

Over the coming decade we will expand T1 International, and build new domestic terminal facilities, a parallel runway, two multi-storey carparks and our first airport hotel. This will deliver one airport for the people of Western Australia which will host all flight services in a central location giving passengers a seamless, world-class travel experience.

The Perth Airport estate is spread over 2100 hectares and has developed a $1.5 billion portfolio of existing industrial premises and significant vacant land holdings.

We service a truly diverse community and play an important role in strengthening cultural, family and social bonds while supporting business, tourism and leisure travel.

We are on the lookout for a commercially minded Energy Analyst to provide timely, accurate and insightful analysis that supports Perth Airport’s energy strategy. Working closely with the Energy team, this role will mature our energy offerings, assess renewable integration opportunities, and deliver technical and financial insights that inform sound commercial decision-making and long-term value creation.

About the role

Develop and maintain energy modelling, reporting and assessment tools
Deliver technical and commercial analysis for energy projects and initiatives
Build and maintain financial models to support tariffs and revenue optimisation
Analyse energy market data to inform strategy and investment decisions
Improve energy data collection, automation and reporting capabilities
Support compliance with Alternative Electricity Services and reporting obligations
Provide analytical input into business cases and approval papers

About you

Degree or equivalent experience in engineering, finance, economics or similar
Minimum three years’ experience in an analytical or energy-related role
Strong understanding of grid and renewable energy markets
Advanced skills in Excel, PowerBI and energy/data management tools
Proven financial modelling capability, including DCF analysis
Commercially aware, with sound judgement and attention to detail
Clear communicator able to translate complex analysis for stakeholders
Collaborative, safety-focused and adaptable in a dynamic environment

About Us:

We offer a dynamic and supportive team culture, a contemporary workplace with great facilities and a modern approach to work/life integration. Our competitive remuneration package comes with additional company benefits including free parking.

Perth Airport is an Equal Opportunities Employer. We are committed to building an equitable and diverse workforce representative of the community we serve. We encourage and welcome applications from all communities and backgrounds.

Doing the right thing by the planet and future generations is important to us. At PAPL we place a strong emphasis on embedding sustainability throughout our business strategy and operations. We remain steadfast in our commitment to driving ESPG (Environmental, Social, People, Governance) performance across our value chain and areas that have material environmental and social impact.

If this sounds like you please get in touch.

About CBUS
 
Created by workers, for workers, CBUS Super is one of Australia’s most successful Superannuation funds. For over four decades we’ve proudly represented those who help shape Australia, hard-working individuals who deserve to make the most of their retirement, no matter the industry. As an award-winning fund we’ve been recognised for the benefits provided to our members and our innovative investment approach.  All while staying committed to our member first ethos as a proud Industry Fund.
 
About the role
 
The Senior Business Analyst, Data & Analytics focuses on leveraging member and fund data to translate complex business questions into clear, data driven insights and well-defined analytical requirements. By acting as a key link between business stakeholders, enterprise delivery and technical teams, the role ensures data solutions are aligned to member needs, operational priorities and regulatory obligations.
 
Reporting to the Head of Member Analytics & Insights, you will lead analysis of complex datasets across superannuation products, member behaviour, fund administration and regulatory reporting. Applying a deep knowledge of the superannuation environment. This role is important because it enables CBUS to make informed, evidence-based decisions- improving fund performance, compliance, member engagement and retention- while also uplifting data and analytics practices to drive continuous improvement and long-term strategic value.
 
Key Accountabilities

Lead end-to-end data and analytics requirements discovery, translating complex business, member and regulatory needs into clear, traceable analytical and reporting requirements
Produce high-quality data and analytics documentation, including BRDs, user stories, process flows, data workflows and standard operations procedures that support compliance and audit readiness
Partner with stakeholders across Member Analytics & Insights, MEX, Strategy & Growth, , Enterprise, Data & Tech, Finance and external providers to prioritise, design and deliver improved data models, reporting and analytic solutions
Work closely with data architects, engineers, and reporting teams to support solution design, testing and delivery, ensuring requirements are met through deployment
Lead business data analysis workstreams across enterprise initiatives and regulatory programs, contributing to planning, governance, delivery tracking and issue escalation
What will you bring?

Experience in a similar Senior Business Analyst, Project or Product Delivery role in Superannuation or Financial Services with a strong track record across complex, data-driven initiatives
Deep capability in requirements gathering, process and data analysis, gap analysis and end-to-end testing, including high quality documentation (BRDs, user stories, functional specs etc.)
Strong understanding of regulatory environments (APRA, ASIC, ATO) and the ability to translate legislative obligations into clear business and data requirements
Advanced analytical and data skills with a focus on data governance, quality, insights generations and supporting strategic decision-making
Outstanding stakeholder management and communication skills with experience working across Agile and Waterfall environments, leading analysis workstreams and collaborating in values-driven member focused teams
Belong at CBUS
 
We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. We believe that, with diversity of perspectives and experiences, you get better teams and outcomes. We’re looking for people of all genders, races, nationalities, orientations and of all abilities to join us.
 
We’re keen to hear from you
 
If you've read through the requirements of this role and you feel like you haven’t fully met the criteria, we would still encourage you to apply. We're aware of accessibility barriers when it comes to applying for a job and we want to help. If you require assistance with your application, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team via careers@cbussuper.com.au 
 
Like to know more about working with CBUS? Listen to some of our videos with members of the CBUS team on our website, cbussuper.com.au/careers
 
Applications Close: Thursday 12 March 2026 
 
This is a full time-position based in Melbourne
 
Agencies, please note: All CBUS vacancies are managed by our internal Talent Acquisition Team.  Should external assistance be required we will reach out to our preferred agency partners, Thank you.

About the Role
We’re excited to partner exclusively with Brighter Super to recruit an Investment Performance Analyst. This role offers the chance to contribute directly to the fund’s investment reporting capability by producing accurate, timely, and insightful performance analytics. Based in either Brisbane or Sydney, you’ll collaborate with investment, risk and operations teams, while helping uplift reporting processes through enhanced data, automation and business intelligence.
  
Key Responsibilities

Prepare, validate and distribute daily, weekly and monthly investment performance and exposure reports
Partner with the custodian and performance analytics provider to maintain accuracy and consistency across reporting
Analyse and interpret investment performance, contributing meaningful commentary for internal and external stakeholders
Support automation and improvements across the performance reporting ecosystem, including BI tools such as Power BI
Work collaboratively with Investment, Market Risk and Finance teams to resolve queries and ensure reporting is fit‑for‑purpose
  
About You

3–5 years’ investment performance analytics experience within superannuation or funds management (mandatory)
Strong understanding of portfolio performance, attribution and exposure reporting
Exposure to performance or risk systems (e.g. FactSet, Aladdin, Axioma, MSCI)
Strong analytical capability, including advanced Excel and data/reporting skills
Strong communication skills with the ability to build effective relationships across internal and external stakeholders
  
About the Company
Brighter Super is a growing, member‑focused Australian superannuation fund with a national presence and a clear commitment to delivering strong, long‑term outcomes for its members. Operating across Queensland and expanding into key financial hubs such as Sydney, the fund manages a diverse and sophisticated investment portfolio supported by robust operational, data and risk frameworks. Brighter Super is known for its collaborative culture, accessible leadership, and strong purpose orientation, making it an exciting environment for investment and operations professionals seeking to make a meaningful impact.
  
For more information or a confidential discussion, please apply.

Brighter Futures Start Here

We are an inclusive team who power two of the most iconic and loved brands, Kmart and Target. We have more than 50,000 passionate individuals across our stores, distribution centres, and offices around the globe.

With our brands touching the lives of almost two million customers every week, you'll feel the impact of the work you'll do every day. As a leader in the retail market, we're optimistic about our future and yours. We're changing at a rapid rate, giving you challenging work that you'll be proud of.

Join the team



We're looking for a Senior Learning Systems Specialist to step into a pivotal role supporting Kmart Group's learning technology ecosystem across Kmart and Target brands. As the senior technical lead and 2IC within the Learning Systems team, you'll play a key role in ensuring our learning platforms are stable, compliant, well‑governed, and continuously improving for team members and contractors.


If you're passionate about learning technology, governance, and complex system environments and love making things work better, this is the role for you.

What you'll be doing

As a Senior Learning Systems Specialist working for Kmart Group you will:

Lead technical governance across LMS configurations, system standards, naming conventions, rulesets, and quality controls.
Perform complex configuration changes, troubleshoot issues with IT and vendors, and act as the senior escalation point for technical challenges.
Oversee data integrity, conduct audits, and ensure integrations and audience structures operate accurately and reliably.
Support content developers and instructional designers with course setup, structure, navigation, and multimedia integration.
Manage release cycles including UAT, regression testing, deployment coordination, and post‑release validation.
Provide advanced technical support to users and act as the subject matter expert for all learning systems matters.
Oversee BAU workload, triage escalations, and operate as day‑to‑day 2IC when the Manager is unavailable.
Develop reporting solutions, analyse learning data, and provide insights that support compliance and decision‑making.


To be successful in this role you'll have:



Advanced LMS configuration expertise across program structures, certifications, rules, permissions, automation and audience structures.
Strong experience in system governance, quality gates, change control, and risk management.
Proven experience managing release cycles, upgrades, migrations, hotfixes, and UAT processes.
Previous experience implementing or supporting AI‑enabled features within LMS platforms (e.g., recommendations, adaptive pathways, AI‑driven analytics).
A passion for emerging learning technologies, with the ability to assess, pilot and safely integrate AI‑powered tools that enhance efficiency and learner experience.
Solid understanding of integrations, APIs, and HR data flows in complex environments.
Demonstrated project management capabilities, including scoping, planning and delivering learning system projects.
Experience working in high‑volume, multi‑stakeholder environments with competing priorities and tight timeframes.
Strong documentation skills with the ability to create system guides, process documentation and user tools.
Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively with IT, Safety, Audit, Operations and other business units.

Benefits we'll offer you:

Flexible hybrid working options through our Flex Where, Flex When, Flex Well policy.
A team member discount card that gives you a discount at Kmart, Target, Officeworks and Bunnings
Access to the Kmart for You benefits program which entitles you to exclusive discounts and benefits in the areas of entertainment, travel, lifestyle, and health - with over 60 suppliers!
We want you to feel rewarded for your commitment and hard work that's why eligible team members get the opportunity to participate in a bonus program
We offer inclusive parental leave, and ongoing support offered though our partnership with Circle In for team members of all backgrounds and family circumstances
A dynamic learning and support program
Opportunity to fast track your career through our Mentor Program as a Mentee or Mentor
A Kudos recognition program, where you are nominated by your peers to spin a wheel, to win a stack of cool prizes
Great career opportunities across the broader Wesfarmers Group


We celebrate the rich diversity of the communities in which we operate. We are committed to creating inclusive and safe environments where all our team members can contribute and succeed. We believe that all team members should feel valued, respected and safe, and strive to ensure our recruitment process is accessible and welcoming, with applications encouraged from all candidates.

We encourage you to tell us about any workplace adjustments that you would like, by emailing kmartgroupcareers@kmart.com.au.

If you would like to explore a career with Kmart and this sounds like the perfect role for you - apply now!

#LI-Hybrid

Take hold of a monster opportunity and join our Product team as a Product Governance Manager.  If you’re a good fit for this role and live in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne, we’d love you to apply. 

Why join us?

You'll get 14% super as standard, to help your future come alive.
Unleash your potential and build a career to be proud of through excellent training and development opportunities.
Balance your work between in-person days at our purpose-built hubs and working from home.
In the office, enjoy end of trip facilities, a yoga and multi-faith room, parent and carer rooms, quiet rooms, BrewHub coffee facilities, and collaborative team spaces.

About the role

We’re all about helping our members make the most of their money. And while they go after their goals, you can too. As a Product Governance Manager, you’ll play a pivotal role in ensuring our product portfolio is supported by a robust, consistent and future‑focused governance framework. Working closely with senior leaders and product teams, you’ll help translate regulatory obligations into practical governance that genuinely supports better decision‑making. Your work will span the full product lifecycle — from design and change through to ongoing monitoring — with a strong focus on evidence, insight and outcomes.

 

Day to day, you'll:

Define, maintain and operate the product governance framework, including governance standards, controls, processes and reporting across ART’s product suite. 
Lead product governance monitoring and reporting, producing dashboards and governance packs, identifying trends and emerging risks, and driving actions through to closure across all product lines.
Embed product lifecycle governance, supporting product teams to apply product design, distribution and review practices, including documented review triggers and outcomes monitoring where applicable.
Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in product management. Apply this knowledge to continuously improve processes and outcomes.

This role is a permanent, full-time opportunity. 

📍 Location: BNE/SYD/MEL

About you

It goes without saying you'll be a great communicator with top notch interpersonal skills. We'll also expect you to pick up problems and come up with quick, creative ways to solve them. It's quite likely you tick some of the following boxes too:  

Strong business acumen with a proven ability to build and maintain effective relationships and influence outcomes with senior stakeholders.
Advanced analytical capability, using multiple data sources to generate insights, shape governance/performance reporting, and identify continuous improvement opportunities (e.g., Excel, Power BI, SharePoint).
Demonstrated experience running governance processes (standards, controls, reporting, review cadence) and maintaining robust evidence suitable for internal assurance and regulatory review.
Working knowledge of superannuation product governance obligations and relevant regulatory guidance (e.g., ASIC RG 274; APRA SPS 530 and SPS 250).

About us

Our 2.4 million members trust us to take care of over $330 billion in retirement savings. And we help them take charge of their finances and face the future with confidence. Our inclusive culture means you’ll be valued and heard in a respectful workplace. We've created an environment where you can be yourself and do amazing work. It's that simple.

Apply online now

Everyone is welcome to apply. We value diverse thinking, cultures, perspectives, backgrounds, and abilities. Awaken your career at Australian Retirement Trust and apply now. Applications close Tuesday 10-March 2026. 

We don’t want to leave you with a monstrous wait. So, you’ll hear from us after the closing date to find out whether you’ve made it through to the next round or not. Being fair and up-front is important to us – and recruitment is no different.

This role offers the chance to contribute directly to the fund’s investment reporting capability by producing accurate, timely, and insightful performance analytics. Based in either Brisbane or Sydney, you’ll collaborate with investment, risk and operations teams, while helping uplift reporting processes through enhanced data, automation and business intelligence.
  
Key Responsibilities

Prepare, validate and distribute daily, weekly and monthly investment performance and exposure reports
Partner with the custodian and performance analytics provider to maintain accuracy and consistency across reporting
Analyse and interpret investment performance, contributing meaningful commentary for internal and external stakeholders
Support automation and improvements across the performance reporting ecosystem, including BI tools such as Power BI
Work collaboratively with Investment, Market Risk and Finance teams to resolve queries and ensure reporting is fit‑for‑purpose
  
About You

3–5 years’ investment performance analytics experience within superannuation or funds management (mandatory)
Strong understanding of portfolio performance, attribution and exposure reporting
Exposure to performance or risk systems (e.g. FactSet, Aladdin, Axioma, MSCI)
Strong analytical capability, including advanced Excel and data/reporting skills
Strong communication skills with the ability to build effective relationships across internal and external stakeholders

About the role


In this role, you will partner closely with the Head of Group Strategy and GM Corporate Strategy, Business Development & Capital to design and deliver Coles’ long‑term strategic agenda. You will play a critical role in shaping enterprise priorities, supporting executive decision‑making, and delivering high‑impact strategic initiatives across the Group.


You will empower and guide others to generate hypotheses, conduct robust data analysis, synthesise and interpret key themes and trends, and develop structured, evidence‑based solutions to complex business problems. Your key responsibilities will include:



Provide fact‑based insight to assist the development and delivery of key finance and enterprise strategy initiatives.
Lead the development and execution of project plans aligned to the Group’s strategic priorities, providing clear direction to the team.
Drive the delivery and alignment of the Group’s corporate plan.
Lead analysis and structured problem‑solving to develop and articulate initiatives, recommendations, and success metrics on priority strategic issues.
Identify key risks across in‑scope projects and proactively develop mitigation strategies.
Work collaboratively with senior stakeholders as a strategic thought partner, driving alignment and execution of enterprise strategic initiatives.
Guide and support the team in applying effective, efficient analytical methods while ensuring accuracy and quality of analysis.
Facilitate workshops and strategic discussions to advance problem solving, build buy‑in, and achieve agreed outcomes.

About you and your skills


You are an exceptional strategic thinker with demonstrated experience solving complex problems, shaping strategic recommendations, and delivering high‑quality analysis. You bring strong leadership capabilities and can inspire and develop a high‑performing team.


You’ll also have:



Experience in top‑tier management consulting (MBB strongly preferred) or a Corporate/Retail Strategy function within a large, complex organisation.
Experience in writing or contributing to board-level presentations and reports.
Proven experience managing people and delivering projects end‑to‑end.
Deep capability in analytical problem solving, financial analysis and building/working with financial models.
High proficiency using advanced analytical tools and structured problem‑solving techniques.

What’s in it for you?

Flexible working options: We know that work is only one part of your life, so we actively encourage a positive work-life balance and provide hybrid working options to help you achieve it.
Office perks: Take advantage of our gym facility and fitness classes, free parking, BBQ area, mini-Coles supermarket, fooderie hub where you can sample new products before they hit the shelves, school holiday program and so much more when you come in.
Discounts: Eligible team members receive 5% discount all year round on your Supermarket and Liquor online and in-store purchases. We also offer additional periods of double discount (10%) at various times throughout the year. As well as hotdeals exclusive to team members that translate into additional savings.
Reward through recognition: Give and receive recognition, linked to our Coles values, through our digital recognition platform ‘mythanks’. You can accumulate points to redeem in the online shop for exciting gifts and electronic gift cards from an extensive range of retailers.
Opportunities for learning and development: No matter where you start within our diverse business, you’ll have experiences, exposure, and education to satisfy you. Discover and explore a variety of career development programs and job-specific training.
Paid parental leave: We understand how important your life outside work is and offer permanent team members paid parental leave to support you in balancing work and family.
Investment in your future: Our annual team member share plan offer allows eligible team members to make regular pre-tax salary sacrifice deductions to purchase Coles Group shares.

About the recruitment process

We’re continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that is just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We are committed to creating a workplace that is safe and respectful for our team. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities.

We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. For further information and additional contact details visit the ‘Our Recruitment Process’ section of our careers site or email inclusionrecruitment@coles.com.au

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to be assigned to an M365 Project which involves requirements definition, design, and deployment of core M365 services including SharePoint Online, OneDrive for Business, Microsoft Teams, Data Loss Prevention (DLP), and Microsoft Copilot.

You will:

Undertake business and system analysis activities for a complex ICT project delivering Microsoft 365 services, ensuring alignment with project objectives, ASD Blueprints, and organisational requirements.
Build strong relationships with business, technical and governance stakeholders; facilitate workshops and lead discussions to elicit, analyse, and validate business, functional and non‑functional requirements.
Analyse and document end-to-end requirements for the in-scope Microsoft 365 services, such as SharePoint Online, OneDrive for Business, Microsoft Teams, DLP and Copilot.
Develop and maintain clear requirements artefacts such as user stories, acceptance criteria, and functional specifications to support solution design, testing, and delivery.
Ensure traceability of requirements through design, build, testing, deployment, and transition to business as usual using DevOps and supporting documentation.
Work closely with solution architects and technical teams to ensure business requirements are accurately reflected in technical designs.
Support testing and deployment activities, including development of test scenarios, support to user acceptance testing, and validation of delivered M365 solutions against agreed requirements.

The Must Haves:

Demonstrated experience working with Microsoft 365 or similar enterprise collaboration platforms, including requirements relating to SharePoint Online, OneDrive, Microsoft Teams, Co-pilot, and other information protection controls.
Demonstrated experience creating, managing, and maintaining delivery artefacts in Azure DevOps (or equivalent), including backlogs, user stories, and acceptance criteria.

You MUST be an Australian Citizen and hold a minimum of an NV1 Security Clearance to be considered for this position.

For more information contact Mitchell on 0425 269 780

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for this position.

We are seeking TWO experienced Business Analysts to be assigned to an Exchange Project which involves requirements definition, design and deployment of exchange and mailbox migrations as part of a wider modernisation program.

These are Hybrid roles and will require you to work in the Canberra office 3 days per week.

Role One

You will:

Undertake business and system analysis activities for a complex ICT project, deliver migration of services, ensure alignment with project objectives, ASD Blueprints, and organisational requirements.
Build strong relationships with business, technical and governance stakeholders; facilitate workshops and lead discussions to elicit, analyse, and validate business, functional and non‑functional requirements.
Analyse and document end‑to‑end requirements for the in-scope exchange solution.
Develop and maintain clear requirements artefacts such as user stories, acceptance criteria, and functional specifications to support solution design, testing, migration, and delivery.
Ensure traceability of requirements through design, build, testing, deployment, and transition to business‑as‑usual using DevOps and supporting documentation.
Working closely with solution architects and technical teams to ensure business and technical requirements are accurately reflected in technical designs.
Support testing and deployment activities, including development of test scenarios, support to user acceptance testing and validation of delivered solutions against agreed requirements.
Demonstrated experience working with Microsoft and Exchange online, including requirements relating to complex migrations.

Role 2
    
The technical business analyst will be assigned to the Data Remediation and Migration project responsible for complex migration of the wider program within the Department.
The business analyst will:

Undertake business and system analysis activities for a complex ICT program, ensuring alignment with program objectives.

Analyse and profile data to discover patterns, gaps, and data anomalies.

Morgan McKinley are exclusively supporting a client looking for a Senior Risk Analyst for an initial 6 month contract (with the likelihood to extend), to work on a hybrid basis in either Sydney or Melbourne.

The Senior Risk Analyst partners with Member Operations business units to manage risk, incidents, and obligations in alignment with the organisation's Risk Management Framework.

This role is responsible for executing the first-line Risk and Controls programme to mature the end-to-end control environment, driving thematic reviews, and providing advisory on strategic projects. Execute the annual Risk and Controls plan, including thematic reviews, control testing, and validation of self-assessments.

Provide expert risk advisory and sign-off for change initiatives and strategic projects to ensure operational readiness.
Prepare and present insightful risk reporting and dashboards to management forums, identifying emerging trends and systemic issues.
Foster strong partnerships with internal departments and strategic third-party providers to ensure a consistent approach to risk management.

Minimum of five years' experience in operational risk management, ideally within the financial services or insurance sectors.
Comprehensive knowledge of risk and compliance frameworks, incident management practices, and control environments.
Advanced analytical skills with the ability to diagnose root causes and translate complex technical data into actionable business insights.
Proven track record of influencing senior stakeholders and maintaining high-quality professional relationships at all levels.
Highly autonomous worker with the ability to manage conflicting priorities in a rapidly changing environment.

Company Description


Who we are:

Founded in 2013, Ignition is the leading revenue generation platform for accounting and professional services businesses to spark greater efficiency and profitability.

Ignition automates and optimizes proposals, billing, payments and workflows in a single platform that fits seamlessly into existing technology stacks.

With a vision to transform how professional services and their clients do business together, Ignition empowers 8,500+ businesses to reach their full revenue potential.

To date, Ignition customers have engaged over 1.9 million clients and generated US $12b in revenue via the platform. 

Ignition’s global workforce spans Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the Philippines, US and the UK.

Company Values:

We are better every day
We work without ego
We are smarter together
We hero our customer

Where and how we work:

We are open to candidates based in Sydney or Melbourne with full Australian work rights. We operate in a hybrid model, giving you flexibility to work from home, a shared workspace, or a combination of both.

Job Description


About the role:

The Senior Director of Finance & Strategy is a senior finance leader responsible for enterprise financial planning, performance management, and strategic execution. Reporting to the CFO, this role combines traditional company planning, reporting rigor, and KPI governance with modern systems building, embedded AI workflows, and advanced analytics capabilities.

This position will drive financial discipline while building scalable systems and intelligent workflows that enable data-driven decision-making across the organization.

What your day to day will look like:

1. Enterprise Planning & FP&A Leadership

Own the annual operating plan (AOP), long-range planning (LRP), and rolling forecast processes.
Lead company-wide budgeting, re-forecasting, and scenario modelling.
Develop driver-based financial models aligned to SaaS metrics (ARR, NRR, CAC, LTV, gross margin, churn).
Deliver executive-ready reporting for CFO, CEO, and Board.
Ensure forecast accuracy, strong variance analysis, and forward-looking risk assessment.

2. Reporting, Metrics & KPI Governance

Establish and govern enterprise KPI frameworks aligned to company strategy.
Ensure consistency in definitions and integrity across financial and operational metrics.
Collaborate with RevOps on monthly and quarterly business reviews with clear performance narratives.
Drive accountability across functions through data transparency and measurable targets.

3. Strategic Finance & Corporate Strategy

Partner with the CFO to translate strategy into measurable financial outcomes.
Steward capital allocation analysis, pricing strategy, unit economics optimization, and investment prioritization.
Build business cases for product launches, market expansion, and strategic initiatives.
Support potential M&A evaluation and integration planning as needed.

4. Systems Building & Workflow Optimization

Design and implement scalable finance systems and processes.
Oversee ERP, planning systems, and reporting tools optimization.
Integrate automation and AI into finance workflows (forecasting, reconciliations, reporting, scenario planning).
Improve operational efficiency by reducing manual processes and increasing system integration.
Partner with Engineering and Data teams to ensure financial systems integrate seamlessly into the broader tech stack.
 

5. Data, Analytics & AI Enablement

Build and oversee a modern financial data architecture with a single source of truth.
Leverage advanced analytics and AI to enhance forecasting accuracy and predictive modeling.
Embed AI into workflow decision-making (e.g., automated variance explanations, anomaly detection, cash flow prediction).
Promote data governance, reporting accuracy, and analytical rigor across the organization.
 

6. Stakeholder Management

Serve as a trusted advisor to the CFO and executive leadership team.
Partner closely with Revenue, Product, Operations, and Engineering leaders.
Present financial insights in a clear, strategic, and decision-oriented manner.
Support external stakeholder interactions including Board and investors where applicable.

7. Team Leadership

Lead and develop the FP&A and strategic finance teams.
Strengthen financial acumen across the organization.
Build scalable processes and team structures to support growth.

Qualifications


 What you need to succeed:

10+ years of progressive finance experience, including senior FP&A or strategic finance leadership.
Strong experience in SaaS environments, with a solid understanding of recurring revenue models, subscription metrics and unit economics is required.
Experience with embedded fintech models (e.g., payments, capital, billing infrastructure) is considered an advantage.
Experience implementing and enhancing finance systems and processes.
Experience embedding AI and automation into finance workflows.
Advanced financial modeling and analytical skills.
Exceptional executive communication and stakeholder management capabilities.

Additional Information


Why join us:

Join our global SaaS scale up company where we foster a collaborative, open, and transparent culture and work without ego. Our team comprises curious and intelligent colleagues who embrace challenges. Here's what we offer:

Competitive salary package plus employee stock options from day one
Annual education allowance to support your professional development
Employee recognition program that celebrates impact and contribution
Quarterly wellness allowance to support your physical and mental wellbeing
Complimentary subscriptions to Headspace and our Employee Assistance Program 
Flexible working, supported by work-from-office reimbursement and a mobile allowance to help you set up safely at home
Work from anywhere for up to one month each year, with business approval
Financial Planning allowance (after all, we are in the accounting business!)
Vehicle Leasing Benefits
Paid parental leave
An extra paid day off for your birthday, plus paid volunteering leave

What to expect from our recruitment process:

Introductory conversation with our Talent team: A friendly discussion to learn more about your background and share additional context about the role and Ignition.
Hiring Manager conversation: A focused discussion on your experience, strengths, leadership approach, and alignment with our strategic priorities.
CEO conversation: An introduction to our company vision and strategy, and a discussion on the impact this role will have on the business.
Functional and stakeholder interviews: A series of structured conversations with cross functional leaders  to explore leadership, collaboration, culture, and how we work together.
Take home case study and presentation: An opportunity to work through a practical, role relevant scenario and share your thinking with key stakeholders.
Reference and background checks: Conducted following acceptance of a verbal offer.

We may use AI enabled tools to support parts of our recruitment process, such as improving efficiency in scheduling and note taking. These tools are used responsibly and never replace human decision-making, all hiring decisions are made by our people.

We aim to keep the process transparent, respectful of your time, and as smooth as possible.

We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement, experience comes in many forms, and diverse perspectives make our teams stronger.

Ignition is an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodations during the recruitment process or need materials in an alternative format, please contact careers@ignitionapp.com.
